com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FSelectableTable<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
      • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FContainer
        • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FTable
          • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FSelectableTable<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The generic type of the underlying table model, i.e. the type of the associated object.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener

    public class FSelectableTable<T>
extends FTable
    A table for selectable components: the table takes as input a FSelectableTableModel, which renders a checkbox in the first column of each row. The FSelectableTableModel has an associated object for each row, which can be retrieved via getSelectedObjects().

    For convenience this table provides methods for adding control components (e.g. buttons), which are rendered below the table.

    Author:
    as

      • render

        public java.lang.String render()
        Description copied from class: FContainer
        draw the HTML anchors of the kids - populate view will be triggered from the page since the components are all registered. The specific implementation should override this method since it only providers a very basic layout
        Overrides:
        render in class FTable
        Returns:

      • populateView

        public void populateView()
        Description copied from class: FTable
        The goal of this overriding is preventing the double rendering of components that are part of the table body. Without this override, the method FComponent.populateView() of instances within the table would be called twice:
        1. During the invocation of FTable.render()
        2. During the invocation of FComponent.populateView() on this
        The double rendering of components may result in a possibly a costly overhead and even in the breaking of such components, e.g. charts, which rely on known div identifiers to rendering relying on javascript code.
        Overrides:
        populateView in class FTable
